title: Create a custom Freedom UI page for an existing object
content_markdown:
Version: 8.3All Creatio products
On this page
You can set up a custom Freedom UI record page for any out-of-the-box or custom Creatio object in an editable app using no-code tools. This can be done in several ways:
* Set up a page in an app data model. Read more >>>
* Set up a page while setting up **Button** or **List** Freedom UI components. Read more >>>
Important
Creatio objects can have both a Freedom UI and Classic UI form page. Learn more in a separate article: [Manage the form pages in the Freedom UI and Classic UI shell](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2413).
Creatio stores the custom Freedom UI record page in the app where you created it. The page is bound to the object via the "Addon" type schema stored in the app where you bound the page to the object. The app, page, and schema must be present in the environment for the functionality to operate as intended.
## Set up a custom Freedom UI record page in an app data model​
You can set up a custom record page in a data model of an editable app. For example, this is useful if you need to create a custom record page for an out-of-the-box Creatio object and the page is the only Freedom UI functionality required.
### Set up a custom Freedom UI record page for an out-of-the-box Creatio object​
1. **Click** ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/move_a_classic_ui_section_to_freedom_ui/btn_system_designer.png) in the top right → **Application Hub**.
2. **Create an app** based on a **Custom** template.
3. **Open** the **Data models** tab.
4. **Click** **New data model** → **Replacing object**.
5. Go to the **Inheritance** block and **select the relevant object** in the **Parent object** field. For example, “Account.”
6. **Click** **Save**.
7. **Open** the **Pages** tab.
8. **Select** an existing Freedom UI page in the **Default page** field or click ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/8_1/btn_new.png) to the right of the field to **create and set up a new page** (Fig. 1).
Fig. 1 Create a custom record page
![Fig. 1 Create a custom record page](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/8_1/scr_create_a_record_page.png)
9. **Click** **Save**.
As a result, Creatio will use the page to display individual records of the parent object everywhere in Creatio, including existing sections.
note
In Creatio version 8.0.6 and later you can also add a Freedom UI page for an object that has only classic UI section via Object designer. To do this you will also need to add the new page to the **Edit pages in UIs by object** lookup. Learn more in a separate article: [Manage the form pages in the Freedom UI and Classic UI shell](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2413&anchor=title-2514-2).
### Set up a custom Freedom UI record page for an existing app data model​
1. **Click** ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/move_a_classic_ui_section_to_freedom_ui/btn_system_designer.png) in the top right → **Application Hub**.
2. **Open** the relevant app.
3. **Open** the **Data models** tab.
4. **Open** the needed data model.
5. **Take steps 6-8** of the instructions in the previous section.
As a result, Creatio will use the page to display individual records of the data model everywhere in Creatio, including existing sections.
## Set up a custom Freedom UI record page while setting up Freedom UI components​
You can also set up a custom Freedom UI record page while setting up the [**Button**](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2376&anchor=title-2230-17) or [**List**](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2376&anchor=title-2230-77) Freedom UI components. For example, this is useful if you need to bind the custom record page to additional Freedom UI functionality.
### Use a Button component​
1. **Click** ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/move_a_classic_ui_section_to_freedom_ui/btn_system_designer.png) in the top right → **Application Hub**.
2. **Open** the relevant app.
3. **Open** the page to bind to the custom Freedom UI record page.
4. **Drag** a **Button** component to the canvas. Alternatively, **select** an existing button and click ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/btn_properties.png).
5. Go to the **Action** block in the setup area and **select** **Open new record** or **Open existing record** in the **Action** field depending on your business goals.
6. **Select** the data model whose record page to set up in the **Which record to create?** or **Which object to open record of?** field (Fig. 2). For example, “Account.” The field name is based on the selected action.
Fig. 2 Select a data model
![Fig. 2 Select a data model](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/8_1/scr_select_an_object.png)
7. **Click** ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/btn_page_setup.png) to the right of the field that contains the selected data model. This opens a dialog.
8. **Select** an existing Freedom UI page in the **Default page** field or click ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/btn_add.png) to the right of the field to **create and set up a new page**.
9. **Click** **Save**.
As a result, Creatio will use the page to display individual records of the data model everywhere in Creatio, including existing sections.
### Use a List component​
1. **Click** ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/move_a_classic_ui_section_to_freedom_ui/btn_system_designer.png) in the top right → **Application Hub**.
2. **Open** the relevant app.
3. **Open** the page to bind to the custom Freedom UI record page.
4. **Drag** a **List** component to the canvas. Alternatively, **select** an existing list and click ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/btn_properties.png).
5. **Select** the data model whose record page to set up in the **Object** field of the setup area. For example, “Account.”
6. **Click** ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/btn_page_setup.png) to the right of the **Object** field. This opens a dialog.
7. **Select** an existing Freedom UI page in the **Default page** field of the dialog or click ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/custom_record_pages/btn_add.png) to the right of the field to **create and set up a new page**.
8. **Click** **Save**.
As a result, Creatio will use the page to display individual records of the data model everywhere in Creatio, including existing sections.
* * *
## See also​
[Freedom UI Designer](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2376)
[Set up the app UI](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2379)
[Manage the form pages](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2413)
[Tech Hour: UI/ UX Building pages in Freedom UI Designer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qyqnRbUHnjQ)
[Tech Hour: UI/ UX Best practices in Creatio](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BdoiOu9ncmw)
